result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony Bryan Wood was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any sentence being served.

miscConds.notes: Absolute sobriety. No alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony Bryan Wood

records.addlTxt: 11:02 AM Defendant Anthony Bryan Wood appeared by video, in custody from Dodge Correctional.  Attorney Shanna Sanders appeared by video for Anthony Bryan Wood.  Attorney Richard Jay Sullivan in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives right to appear in person in courtroom.  Defendant pleads guilty to Count 1; Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 2 is dismissed and read in.  Defendant waives right to presentence investigation. Court orders sentence withheld 2 years probation, consecutive to any sentence being served, any treatment deemed necessary, absolute sobriety, no alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription, costs due to Clerk of Court, 0 days sentence credit.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 2, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:41 AM Defendant Anthony Bryan Wood in court in custody from the Rock County Jail by video with attorney Shanna Sanders by video.  Richard Jay Sullivan appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Officer Cole Gille sworn in and testified by video. Witness identfies Defendant. State moves for bind over, Defense objects without argument.  Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for filing of an Information.  Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived.  Defendant pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set.
